text: When will I run out of excuses I ve been contemplating suicide since I was around   I had horrible ocd that went untreated for months  Going on and off antidepressants destroyed my psyche  The only reason I didn t go through with my plan to commit suicide was the thought of my family s reaction  I guess this is pretty common for kids my age   I realized recently that I don t really care about how my family would feel anymore  Recently I came out as bisexual to my family  and they have all been cold to me except for my father  My brother calls me a fag  jokingly  now  he s   and my mother has been making me really uncomfortable with homophobic remarks   I know they would probably be upset if I went through with it  but honestly this has made me kind of not give a shit about how they feel  I m generally an empathetic person  but the more I think about it  the more I realize how much of a personal experience it is and that they shouldn t influence my decision   My father is the only one who I worry about  He has expressed to me multiple times that he would kill himself if I ever chose to do so  This was obviously a way of guilt tripping me out of a suicidal episode a few years ago  and it worked  It feels as if it would be unfair to him if my decision ruins his life  I don t want to be responsible for killing somebody besides myself   I m only sixteen  and I ve considered that maybe my contemplation of suicide is only a side effect of growing older  but I ve been confident in my desire for years  I ve just recently realized that there is only one excuse anymore  and I m wondering when this one will too fade  I almost look foreword to it I guess I m wondering if any of you share a similar experience
summary: 16-year-old is considering suicide. Recently he came out as bisexual to his family and they have all been cold to him except for his father. His brother called him a fag and his mother made him uncomfortable with homophobic remarks. His father has expressed that he would kill himself if he ever chose to do so.
cleaned: year old consider suicide recently come bisexual family cold father brother call fag mother uncomfortable homophobic remark father express kill choose

text: i know i m probably going to get hate for this  but  if you re a kid and are in a situation of domestic family violence and you re not stood up for by your parents adults around you  blame should partially be taken on them  i m not saying it s their fault  as they might be scared too  but still  you re free to agree or disagree   i m saying this because even though i was   at the time  i was emotionally abused by my stepfather and it was horrible  most of the time it happened behind my mums back  as he was a little bitch   anyways  when my mum would hear about it she would never really put her foot down  i felt as though that he was always  getting away with it  which made me feel even worse about the situation  sometimes i felt like she didn t care or that it wasn t as bad as i thought it was  making things much worse   but eventually she started to listen to me more and went to the police about it and it made me feel so much better  i knew my mum was scared to face him  as domestic violence can be a terrifying thing  but at the end of the day I was the child and she was the adult   at first i didn t think it was mums fault at all since she was scared of him too  which although it gave more reason for her to back down more  it didn t excuse her from downplaying what was going on anyway  i guess what i m trying to say is that although it s okay for parents and adults to be scared  they should be the ones protecting you  it s not your fault
summary: When she was a kid she was emotionally abused by her stepfather. Her mother didn't do anything about it at first, but eventually she listened to her daughter and went to the police about it. She was scared to face him, but she was scared of him too.
